These are the keyboard shortcuts you'll use most frequently in RStudio. Learning even a few of these will make your workflow much faster!

## Most Essential Shortcuts

| Action | Mac | Windows/Linux |
|--------|-----|---------------|
| **Insert pipe `%>%`** | `Cmd + Shift + M` | `Ctrl + Shift + M` |
| **Insert code chunk** | `Cmd + Option + I` | `Ctrl + Alt + I` |
| **Run current line/selection** | `Cmd + Enter` | `Ctrl + Enter` |
| **Run current chunk** | `Cmd + Shift + Enter` | `Ctrl + Shift + Enter` |
| **Run all chunks above** | `Cmd + Option + P` | `Ctrl + Alt + P` |
| **Comment/uncomment line(s)** | `Cmd + Shift + C` | `Ctrl + Shift + C` |
| **Insert assignment `<-`** | `Option + -` (minus) | `Alt + -` (minus) |

: {.hover tbl-colwidths="\[10, 8, 8\]"}

## Additional Helpful Shortcuts

| Action | Mac | Windows/Linux |
|--------|-----|---------------|
| **Move cursor to source editor** | `Ctrl + 1` | `Ctrl + 1` |
| **Move cursor to console** | `Ctrl + 2` | `Ctrl + 2` |
| **Clear console** | `Ctrl + L` | `Ctrl + L` |
| **Restart R session** | `Cmd + Shift + 0` | `Ctrl + Shift + F10` |
| **Show keyboard shortcut reference** | `Option + Shift + K` | `Alt + Shift + K` |
| **Find in files** | `Cmd + Shift + F` | `Ctrl + Shift + F` |
| **Auto-complete** | `Tab` | `Tab` |
| **Get help for function** | `F1` (cursor on function) | `F1` (cursor on function) |

: {.hover tbl-colwidths="\[10, 8, 8\]"}

## Tips for Learning Shortcuts

- **Start with 2-3**: Don't try to memorize all of these at once. Start with the pipe operator and running code.
- **Use them consistently**: The more you use a shortcut, the more automatic it becomes.
- **View all shortcuts**: In RStudio, go to **Tools → Keyboard Shortcuts Help** or press `Option/Alt + Shift + K` to see the complete list.
- **Customize shortcuts**: You can customize shortcuts in **Tools → Modify Keyboard Shortcuts**.

## The Shortcuts You'll Use Every Class

If you only remember three shortcuts, make them these:

1. **`Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + M`** - Insert pipe `%>%`
2. **`Cmd/Ctrl + Enter`** - Run current line
3. **`Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + C`** - Comment/uncomment

These three will save you countless hours of typing!
